physical_findings: Serpiginous or polycyclic plaques with or without erythema
Appearance of overlapping roof tiles, lace, or fish scales

KOH prep.abnormal_range: Short septate hyphae, numerous chlamydoconidia, no arthroconidia

risk_factors: Living in primitive and isolated environments in developing countries
Indigenous populations in Southeast Asia, Oceania, and Central and South America

required: Characteristic skin lesions: scaly, concentric annular rings and overlapping plaques
supportive: Positive potassium hydroxide (KOH) wet-mount examination showing short septate hyphae, numerous chlamydoconidia, and no arthroconidia
